sen.j: 建仁寺（けんにんじ、けんねんじ）は、京都府京都市東山区にある臨済宗建仁寺派大本山の寺院。
sen.e: Kennin-ji Temple, located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, is the headquarters of the Rinzai sect Kennin-ji School of Zen Buddhism.
Kennin-ji Temple, located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture is the headquarters of the Rinzai sect Kennin-ji School of Zen Buddhism.
Kennin-ji Temple, located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is the headquarters of the Rinzai sect Kennin-ji School of Zen Buddhism.

sen.j: 山号を東山（とうざん）と号する。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Dozan'.
Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Tozan.'
sen.cmt: Tozanに訂正。ピリオドを移動。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is Tozan.

sen.j: 本尊は釈迦如来、開基（創立者）は源頼家、開山は栄西である。
sen.e: The temple was founded by kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) MINAMOTO no Yoriie, kaizan (founding priest) Yosai and is dedicated to the principal image Shaka Nyorai.
sen.cmt: ・principal image: 英辞郎 on the WEB・Shaka Nyorai: http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm・aiki (patron of a temple in its founding): http://www.kcn-net.org/e_kama_history/glossary/glossary.htm
sen.e: The temple was founded by kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) MINAMOTO no Yoriie, kaizan (founding priest) Yosai and is dedicated to the principal image Shaka Nyorai.
The temple was founded by kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) MINAMOTO no Yoriie, kaizan (founding priest) Yosai and is dedicated to the principal image Shaka Nyorai.

sen.j: 日本で最初の禅寺であり、京都五山の第3位に列せられている。
sen.e: It is Japan's oldest Zen temple and the third of the Five Great Zen Temples of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: ・Five Great zen Temples of Kyoto: 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: It is Japan's oldest Zen temple and the third of the Five Great Zen Temples of Kyoto.
It is Japan's oldest Zen temple and the third of the Five Great Zen Temples of Kyoto.

sen.j: 俵屋宗達の「風神雷神図」、海北友松（かいほうゆうしょう）の襖絵などの文化財を豊富に伝える。
sen.e: The site is home to numerous cultural properties including Sotatsu TAWARAYA's "Fujin Raijin zu" (image of the Wind and Thunder Gods) and Kaihou Yusho's sliding screen paintings.
sen.cmt: ・"Fujin Raijin zu" (The Wind and Thunder Gods): http://www.kenninji.jp/english/index.html
sen.e: The site is home to numerous cultural properties including Sotatsu TAWARAYA's 'Fujin Raijin zu' (image of the Wind and Thunder Gods) and Kaihou Yusho's sliding screen paintings.
The site is home to numerous cultural properties including Sotatsu TAWARAYA's 'Fujin Raijin zu' (image of the Wind and Thunder Gods) and Kaiho Yusho's sliding screen paintings.

sen.j: 山内の塔頭としては、桃山時代の池泉回遊式庭園で有名であり、貴重な古籍や、漢籍・朝鮮本などの文化財も多数所蔵していることで知られる両足院などが見られる。
sen.e: The Ryosoku-in sub-temple within the grounds is famous for its Chisen Kaiyu style garden and collection of cultural properties including valuable ancient Japanese books and Chinese and Korean texts.

The Ryosoku-in sub-temple within the grounds is famous for its Chisen Kaiyu style garden in the Momoyama period and collection of cultural properties including valuable ancient Japanese books and Chinese and Korean texts.
sen.cmt: 桃山時代の、部分が抜けている。
sen.e: The Ryosoku-in sub-temple within the grounds is famous for its Chisen Kaiyu style garden in the Momoyama period and collection of cultural properties including valuable ancient Japanese books and Chinese and Korean texts.

sen.j: また、豊臣秀吉を祀る高台寺や、「八坂の塔」のある法観寺は建仁寺の末寺である。
sen.e: Additionally Kodai-ji Temple enshrining Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Hokan-ji Temple with the "Yasaka-no-to" (Yasaka Pagoda) are both branch temples.
Additionally Kodai-ji Temple enshrining Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Hokan-ji Temple with the 'Yasaka-no-to' (Yasaka Pagoda) are both branch temples.
Additionally Kodai-ji Temple enshrining Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Hokan-ji Temple with the 'Yasaka-no-to' (Yasaka Pagoda) are both branch temples.

sen.j: 日本に臨済宗を正式に伝えたのは栄西（ようさい、えいさい）がはじめとされている。
sen.e: The monk Yosei is credited with formally introducing the Rinzai sect to Japan.
The monk Yosai (Eisai) is credited with formally introducing the Rinzai sect to Japan.
The monk Yosai (Eisai) is credited with formally introducing the Rinzai sect to Japan.

sen.j: 栄西は永治元年（1141年）、備中国（岡山県）に生まれた。
sen.e: He was born in Bitchu Province (modern day Okayama Prefecture) in the year 1141.
sen.cmt: ・Bitchu Province: プログレッシブ英和中辞典
sen.e: He was born in Bitchu Province (modern day Okayama Prefecture) in the year 1141.
He was born in Bitchu Province (modern day Okayama Prefecture) in the year 1141.

sen.j: 13歳で比叡山に上り翌年得度（出家）。
sen.e: At age 13 he went to study at Mt. Hiei and was ordained into the priesthood in the following year.
At age 13 he went to study at Mt. Hiei and was ordained into the priesthood in the following year.
At age 13 he went to study at Mt. Hiei and was ordained into the priesthood in the following year.

sen.j: 仁安 (日本)3年（1168年）と文治3年（1187年）の2回、南宋に渡航した。
sen.e: He travelled to Southern Song Period China in both 1168 and 1187.
He travelled to Southern Song Period China in both 1168 and 1187.
He travelled to Southern Song Period China in both 1168 and 1187.

sen.j: 1度目の渡宋はわずか半年であったが、2度目の渡宋の際、臨済宗黄龍派（おうりょうは）の虚庵懐敞（きあんえじょう）に参禅した。
sen.e: His first visit lasted only 6 months but on his second visit he received instruction form Rinzai sect Huanglong school master Xu'an Huaichang.
His first visit lasted only 6 months but on his second visit he received instruction form Rinzai sect Huanglong school master Xu'an Huaichang.
His first visit lasted only 6 months but on his second visit he received instruction form Rinzai sect Huanglong school master Xu'an Huaichang.

sen.j: 建久2年（1191年）、虚庵から印可（師匠の法を嗣いだという証明）を得て、帰国する。
sen.e: In 1191, he received the inka (master's certification of a disciple's completion of training) from Xu'an and returned to Japan.
In 1191, he received the inka (master's certification of a disciple's completion of training) from Xu'an and returned to Japan.
In 1191, he received the inka (master's certification of a disciple's completion of training) from Xu'an and returned to Japan.

sen.j: 当時、京都では比叡山（延暦寺）の勢力が強大で、禅寺を開くことは困難であった。
sen.e: The influence that Mt. Hiei (Enryaku-ji Temple) commanded in Kyoto at the time made it extremely difficult to establish a Zen temple.
The influence that Mt. Hiei (Enryaku-ji Temple) commanded in Kyoto at the time made it extremely difficult to establish a Zen temple.
The influence that Mt. Hiei (Enryaku-ji Temple) commanded in Kyoto at the time made it extremely difficult to establish a Zen temple.

sen.j: 栄西ははじめ九州博多に聖福寺を建て、のち鎌倉に移り、北条政子の援助で正治2年（1200年）に建立された寿福寺の開山となる。
sen.e: After his return, Yosei first built Shofuku-ji Temple in Hakata, Kyushu and later served as kaizan at Jufuku-ji Temple constructed in the year 1200 with the assistance of Masako HOJO.
After his return, Yosai (Eisai) first built Shofuku-ji Temple in Hakata, Kyushu and later served as kaisan at Jufuku-ji Temple constructed in the year 1200 with the assistance of Masako HOJO.
sen.cmt: Yosei→Yosai (Eisai)kaisanに訂正。※辞書その他サイトより
sen.e: After his return, Yosai (Eisai) first built Shofuku-ji Temple in Hakata, Kyushu and later served as kaisan at Jufuku-ji Temple constructed in the year 1200 with the assistance of Masako HOJO.

sen.j: その2年後の建仁2年（1202年）、鎌倉幕府2代将軍源頼家の援助を得て、京都における臨済宗の拠点として建立されたのが建仁寺である。
sen.e: Two years later in 1202, he received the backing of 2nd Kamakura Shogun MINAMOTO no Yoriie and constructed Kennin-ji Temple as a Rinzai sect site in Kyoto.
Two years later in 1202, he received the backing of the 2nd Kamakura Shogun MINAMOTO no Yoriie and constructed Kennin-ji Temple as a Rinzai sect site in Kyoto.
Two years later in 1202, he received the backing of the second Kamakura Shogun MINAMOTO no Yoriie and constructed Kennin-ji Temple as a Rinzai sect site in Kyoto.

sen.j: 伽藍は宋の百丈山に擬して造営された。
sen.e: The monastery was designed to imitate China's Mt Baizhang-shan.
The monastery was designed to imitate Song China's Mt Baizhang-shan.
The monastery was designed to imitate Song China's Mt Baizhang-shan.

sen.j: 創建当時の建仁寺は天台、真言、禅の3宗並立であった。
sen.e: When Kennin-ji Temple was founded, it also served as a center for the Tendai and Shingon sects in addition to the Rinzai sect.
sen.cmt: ・Tendai sect: 英辞郎 on the WEB、およびhttp://21dzk.l.u-tokyo.ac.jp/INBUDS/search.php?m=trdd&usid=59058&a=・Shingon sect: 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: When Kennin-ji Temple was founded, it also served as a center for the Tendai and Shingon sects in addition to the Zen sect.
When Kennin-ji Temple was founded, it also served as a center for the Tendai and Shingon sects in addition to the Zen sect.

sen.j: これは当時の京都では真言、天台の既存宗派の勢力が強大だったことが背景にある。
sen.e: This was due to the great influence that the Shingon and Tendai sects already wielded in Kyoto at the time.
sen.cmt: ・Tendai sect: 英辞郎 on the WEB、およびhttp://21dzk.l.u-tokyo.ac.jp/INBUDS/search.php?m=trdd&usid=59058&a=・Shingon sect: 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: This was due to the great influence that the Shingon and Tendai sects already wielded in Kyoto at the time.
This was due to the great influence that the Shingon and Tendai sects already wielded in Kyoto at the time.

sen.j: 創建から半世紀以上経た正元 (日本)元年（1259年）には宋僧の蘭渓道隆（らんけいどうりゅう、鎌倉建長寺の開山）が11世住職として入寺し、この頃から純粋禅の寺院となる。
sen.e: It was not until over half a century after its founding, in 1259, that the temple became purely a Zen temple when Chinese monk Lanxi Daolong (kaizan of the Kamakura period temple Kencho-ji) assumed the position of Kennin-ji Temple's 11th chief priest.

It was not until over half a century after its founding, in 1259, that the temple became purely a Zen temple when Chinese monk Lanxi Daolong (kaisan of the Kamakura period temple Kencho-ji) assumed the position of Kennin-ji Temple's 11th chief priest.

It was not until over half a century after its founding, in 1259, that the temple became purely a Zen temple when Chinese monk Lanxi Daolong (kaisan of the Kamakura period temple Kencho-ji) assumed the position of Kennin-ji Temple's 11th chief priest.

sen.j: 建仁寺は、応仁の乱による焼失のほか、応永4年（1397年）、文明 (日本)13年（1481年）などたびたび火災にあっており、創建当時の建物は残っていない。
sen.e: Kennin-ji Temple has suffered numerous fires throughout the centuries including during the Onin War, in 1397 and in 1481 so that none of the original buildings remain.
Kennin-ji Temple has suffered numerous fires throughout the centuries including during the Onin War, in 1397 and in 1481 so that none of the original buildings remain.
Kennin-ji Temple has suffered numerous fires throughout the centuries including during the Onin War, in 1397 and in 1481 so that none of the original buildings remain.

sen.j: 勅使門（重文） － 寺の南側正面、八坂通りに面した四脚門。
sen.e: Chokushi-mon Gate (gate for Imperial Envoys) (Important Cultural Property) - This four-legged gate stands at the southern entrance to the temple facing Yasaka-dori Road.
Chokushi-mon Gate (gate for Imperial Envoys) (Important Cultural Property) - This four-legged gate stands at the southern entrance to the temple facing Yasaka-dori Road.
Chokushi-mon Gate (gate for Imperial Envoys) (Important Cultural Property) - This four-legged gate stands at the southern entrance to the temple facing Yasaka-dori Road.

sen.j: 平教盛の館門（平重盛の館門とも）を応仁の乱後に移築したものと伝えるが定かでない。
sen.e: It is said to have been relocated to its current site, having originally stood as the gate at the mansion of TAIRA no Norimori (and TAIRA no Shigemori) but this is not known for sure.
It is said to have been relocated to its current site, having originally stood as the gate at the mansion of TAIRA no Norimori (and TAIRA no Shigemori) but this is not known for sure.

It is said to have been relocated to its current site after the Onin War, having originally stood as the gate at the mansion of TAIRA no Norimori (and TAIRA no Shigemori) but this is not known for sure.

sen.j: 様式的には鎌倉時代末頃の建築である。
sen.e: It has a late Kamakura period architectural style.
It has a late Kamakura period architectural style.
It has a late Kamakura period architectural style.

sen.j: 三門（望闕楼） － 静岡県浜松市（旧浜名郡雄踏町）の安寧寺から1923年に移築したもので、江戸時代末期の建築である。
sen.e: Sanmon gate - This late Edo period structure was relocated from Annei-ji Temple in Hamamatsu City, Shizuoka Prefecture (formerly Hamana-gun, Yuto-cho) in 1923.
Sammon gate - This late Edo period structure was relocated from Annei-ji Temple in Hamamatsu City, Shizuoka Prefecture (formerly Hamana-gun, Yuto-cho) in 1923.
Sammon gate - This late Edo period structure was relocated from Annei-ji Temple in Hamamatsu City, Shizuoka Prefecture (formerly Hamana-gun, Yuto-cho) in 1923.

sen.j: 法堂（はっとう） －仏殿（本尊を安置する堂）と法堂（講堂にあたる）を兼ねている。
sen.e: Hatto (lecture hall) - The same building serves as both the butsuden (hall enshrining the principal image) and hatto (lecture hall).
Hatto (lecture hall) - The same building serves as both the Butsuden (hall enshrining the principal image) and Hatto (lecture hall).
Hatto (lecture hall) - The same building serves as both the Butsuden (hall enshrining the principal image) and Hatto (lecture hall).

sen.j: 明和2年（1765年）の建立。
sen.e: Built in 1765.
Built in 1765.
Built in 1765.

sen.j: また、平成14年(2002年)創建800年を記念して天井に小泉淳作により双龍の絵が描かれた。
sen.e: In 2002, an image of two dragons was painted on the ceiling by Junsaku KOIZUMI to commemorate the temple's 800th anniversary.
In 2002, an image of two dragons was painted on the ceiling by Junsaku KOIZUMI to commemorate the temple's 800th anniversary.
In 2002, an image of two dragons was painted on the ceiling by Junsaku KOIZUMI to commemorate the temple's 800th anniversary.

sen.j: 方丈（重文） － 室町時代の建物で、もと広島の安国寺にあり、安国寺恵瓊が慶長4年（1599年）に建仁寺に移築したもの。
sen.e: Hojo (Abbot's Quarters) (Important Cultural Property) - This Muromachi period building was relocated from Hiroshima's Ankoku-ji Temple in 1599.
Hojo (Abbot's Quarters) (Important Cultural Property) - This Muromachi period building was relocated from Hiroshima's Ankoku-ji Temple to Kennin-ji Temple by Ankokuji Ekei in 1599.
sen.cmt: Abbot’s→Abbot's 安国寺恵瓊→Ankokuji Ekei ※抜けている部分を補足。
sen.e: Hojo (Abbot's Quarters) (Important Cultural Property) - This Muromachi period building was relocated from Hiroshima's Ankoku-ji Temple to Kennin-ji Temple by Ankokuji Ekei in 1599.

sen.j: 建物の外周すべて建具が入り、壁が少ない構造のためか、1934年の室戸台風で倒壊し、1940年に復旧された。
sen.e: The outside of the building is covered with fittings but has few walls and this led to it being heavily damaged in the typhoon of 1934 but it was restored in 1940.
The outside of the building is covered with fittings but has few walls and this led to it being heavily damaged in the Muroto typhoon of 1934 but it was restored in 1940.
The outside of the building is covered with fittings but has few walls and this led to it being heavily damaged in the Muroto typhoon of 1934 but it was restored in 1940.

sen.j: 各室には桃山時代の画壇と代表する画家の1人である海北友松（かいほうゆうしょう）の水墨障壁画があったが、現在は襖から掛軸に改装され、京都国立博物館に寄託されている。
sen.e: Each room was originally adorned by India-ink partition paintings by archetypal Momoyama artist Kaiho Yusho but these have since been deposited at Kyoto National Museum and replaced by hanging scrolls.

Each room was originally adorned by India-ink partition paintings by archetypal Momoyama artist Kaiho Yusho but these have since been deposited at Kyoto National Museum and replaced by hanging scrolls.

Each room was originally adorned by India-ink partition paintings by archetypal Momoyama artist Kaiho Yusho but these have since been deposited at Kyoto National Museum and replaced by hanging scrolls.

sen.j: 台風被害の復旧後は、日本画家橋本関雪による「生生流転」（しょうじょうるてん）の障壁画が設置されている。
sen.e: After restoring the typhoon damage, partition paintings by traditional Japanese-style painter Kansetsu HASHIMOTO were installed.
After restoring the typhoon damage, partition paintings, 'The Cycle of Birth and Death,' by traditional Japanese-style painter Kansetsu HASHIMOTO were installed.
sen.cmt: 用語集より、生生流転→The Cycle of Birth and Death を補足。
sen.e: After restoring the typhoon damage, partition paintings, 'The Cycle of Birth and Death,' by traditional Japanese-style painter Kansetsu HASHIMOTO were installed.

sen.j: 東陽坊－北野大茶会の際に千利休の高弟・真如堂東陽坊長盛が好んだと伝えられる茶室。
sen.e: Toyobo - This teahouse is said to have been enjoyed by SEN no Rikyu's leading disciple Shinnyodo Toyobo Chosei during the Great Kitano Tea Gathering.

sen.j: 二畳台目下座床の席。

sen.j: 構成・意匠ともに薮内家の燕庵に共通する点が多く見られる。
sen.e: The configuration and design incorporates many features common to the Yabunouchi family.
The configuration and design incorporates many features common to the Ennan (tea room) of the Yabunouchi family.

sen.j: 金地の二曲一双屏風のそれぞれに風神と雷神を描く。
sen.e: A pair of gold background two-panel folding screens depicting Fujin and Raijin.
A pair of gold background two-panel folding screens depicting Fujin and Raijin.

sen.j: たっぷりと取られた余白が広い空間を暗示し、天空を駆ける両神のダイナミックな動きを感じさせる。
sen.e: The generous use of empty space creates the dynamic effect of the two gods rushing through the sky.
The generous use of empty space creates the dynamic effect of the two gods rushing through the sky.

sen.j: 俵屋宗達の代表作として名高い。

sen.j: 原本は京都国立博物館に寄託されているが、複製の屏風および陶板は建仁寺で見ることができる。

sen.e: Note: 'Chikurin-Shichiken-zu', 'Kacho-zu', 'Kinki-shoga-zu', 'Unryu-zu' and 'Sansui-zu' are all Hojo partition screen paintings by Kaihou Yusho that have since been replaced by hangings scrolls.
